thread.title: Plans could see the US become part of Commonwealth | Metro News
thread.title_full: Plans could see the US become part of Commonwealth | Metro News

author: Tomeyjes For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Plans could see the US become part of Commonwealth | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 5:22 pm Plans could see the USA become an associate member of the Commonwealth (Picture: PIXEL8000) 
For critics who say the UK has seemed a little too keen to jump into bed with Donald Trump, there may be bad news on the horizon. 
Plans are supposedly in place for the United States to become an ‘associate member’ of the Commonwealth. Pope suggests 'it's better to be an atheist than a hypocritical catholic' 
The Republican, whose mother is Scottish, is known to be fond of Britain and the Royal Family and the plans are seen as parts of efforts to build relationships post-Brexit. 
According to the Telegraph , the first stage would see the Royal Commonwealth Society opening up a branch in the United States. 
A similar thing has happened in Helsinki with a view to boosting business ties with Baltic and Scandinavian countries. Donald Trump is understood to be a royalist (Picture: RUSSELL BOYCE/ REUTERS) The plans could see the RCS open up a branch in New York (Picture: Carl Court/Getty Images) 
A letter to Trump from RCS’ director Michael Lake was handed to Nigel Farage in December and delivered to the former UKIP leader to chief strategist Steve Bannon. 
Mr Lake told the Telegraph the plans had been hastened by the ‘opportunity of a new president’. 
‘The UK rather left this treasure in the attic, and forgot about it because people were so glued to Brussels,’ he added.
